intro: Stellaria abaensis, commonly known as the ABA starwort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers and delicate, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its flowering period occurs during the spring and early summer, and it plays a minor role in local ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
